parts.text: Develop an institutional trading platform with real-time market data feeds, advanced order management systems, comprehensive portfolio tracking, risk controls, regulatory compliance for equities and derivatives, and real-time P&L calculations

Thank you for the request. To get started, we need to set up the repository first. We follow a **GitOps practice**, which means the repo isn't just for code—it's the anchor for your entire project. Setting it up now ensures that every design choice and configuration we make next has a permanent home immediately.

Since we're building an institutional trading platform (real-time market data feeds, advanced OMS, portfolio tracking, risk controls, compliance, and real-time P&L), having the repo initialized up front is important so requirements, designs, and incremental code are tracked and reproducible. Once the repo and branch are created from the standard Cyoda template, we can iterate through Design (Canvas) → Build → Environment → Deploy with the repository as the single source of truth.

When you choose the language and repository strategy below, I'll initialize the repository using the Cyoda template for that stack and generate the branch for our work.

[options-single-choice: Python — Public repo — New Branch, Python — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Python — Private repo — New Branch, Python — Private repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Public repo — New Branch, Java — Public repo — My Existing Branch, Java — Private repo — New Branch, Java — Private repo — My Existing Branch]

Great — thanks. I’ve initialized the repository using the Cyoda Python template and created a branch for our work.

What I did:
- Created a new branch: test-branch-uuid-12345
- Cloned the Cyoda Python template into: /tmp/mocked/repo/path
- The repo is ready as the single source of truth for Design → Build → Environment → Deploy.

Next steps I recommend (brief):
- Define Requirements first so we capture real-time market, OMS, risk, compliance, and P&L expectations.
- Then either analyze the template repo to see available entity/workflow patterns or start designing Entities and Workflows in Canvas.

Choose what you’d like to do next:

[options-single-choice: Define Requirements, Create Entities, Design Workflows, Analyze Repo, Help me run my application locally, Generate Application]

I can generate a complete draft of the functional requirements for your institutional trading platform. I’ll cover scope, core features (real-time market feeds, OMS, portfolio tracking, risk controls, compliance, real-time P&L), integrations, non-functional requirements (latency, throughput, availability), data model touchpoints, and acceptance criteria — then persist the requirements into the repo so we have a single source of truth.

Before I generate the draft, one quick question to tune the requirements profile for your use case:

Which market/regulatory focus should I target for the requirements?

- Focus: US Equities & Derivatives (SEC-focused reporting/compliance)
- Focus: EU Markets (MiFID II / EU derivatives compliance)
- Focus: Global Multi-Asset (Equities & Derivatives across regions)
- Focus: Crypto & Digital Assets (high volatility, exchange connectivity)

Pick the profile below and I’ll produce a tailored functional requirements document and save it to the repository.

[options-single-choice: Focus: US Equities & Derivatives (SEC-focused reporting/compliance), Focus: EU Markets (MiFID II / EU derivatives compliance), Focus: Global Multi-Asset (Equities & Derivatives across regions), Focus: Crypto & Digital Assets (high volatility, exchange connectivity)]
